newsitem.title: LATVIA: OTC MARKET VOLUME SLUMPS IN APRIL WEEK 3.
newsitem.headline: OTC MARKET VOLUME SLUMPS IN APRIL WEEK 3.

text.p: The stock exchange said on Monday that volumes in the over-the-counter market slumped in the third week of April to 184,575 million lats last week versus 443,512 the previous week.
It also compared with volume on the official market in the third week of 495,724 lats.
Valmiera Glassfibre maker dominated the OTC market in the third week with 70,397 lats, the bourse said in a statement.
Fellow secondary list stock Daugavpils Chain registered 55,100 lats of shares on the free market.
Among other shares active on the OTC market from April 14 to April 18 was LMR with 14,239 lats.
Daugavpils and two official list shares, Unibanka and Riga Transport Fleet had the highest volume on the official market that week.
Daugavpils showed volume of 141,893 lats with Unibanka and RTF running up at 77,523 lats and 63,321 lats respectively.
